intro: Ornithogalum orthophyllum, commonly known as the upright star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tall, unbranched stems with clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum orthophyllum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
